abstract.t: This document specifies the Custom Integer Operations Protocol (CIOP), a protocol for performing basic arithmetic operations on integers over a network. The protocol defines message formats and operations for addition, averaging, and set operations between a client and server.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The Custom Integer Operations Protocol (CIOP) is designed to perform basic arithmetic operations on integers transmitted over a network connection. The protocol supports addition, averaging, and summation of sets of integers. The protocol is intended for educational purposes and simple applications requiring basic arithmetic operations over a network.

section.title: Terminology
section.t:
This document uses the following terms:
Protocol - A pre-approved communication language between two end systems. Server - The part of the communication protocol that receives arithmetic operation requests and processes them. In this project, the server performs operations such as addition, averaging, and set summation of integers. Client - The part of the communication protocol that initiates requests for arithmetic operations. In this project, the client sends requests to perform operations on sets of integers to the server. byte - An 8-bit octet
